question: Are self-harm rates among female prisoners more than ten times higher than among male prisoners? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Self-harm rates were more than ten times higher in female prisoners than in male inmates.
content.source_2: In a national cohort from 2004 to 2009, 5–6% of male prisoners and 20–24% of female inmates self-harmed each year, indicating roughly a fourfold difference rather than a tenfold gap.
content.source_3: When expressed as incidents per 1,000 prisoner-years, women in custody demonstrated self-harm rates that exceeded those of men by over an order of magnitude.
content.source_4: After adjustment for age, sentence length, security category, and prior mental health contact, the sex effect on self-harm was reduced to a non-significant 1.3-fold difference.
